docs.snippet: A murder trial is set to begin for a former professional hockey player accused of hiring a man to kill his wife and set fire to their house in New York....
docs.lead_paragraph: A murder trial is set to begin for a former professional hockey player accused of hiring a man to kill his wife and set fire to their house in New York.

headline.main: Trial Set for Ex-Hockey Pro Accused of Hiring Wife's Killer

docs.snippet: Turkish-led air and ground operations in Syria killed 48 Islamic State militants on Sunday while Turkish warplanes destroyed 23 buildings and shelters used by the jihadists, Turkey's armed forces said in a statement on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkish-led air and ground operations in Syria killed 48 Islamic State militants on Sunday while Turkish warplanes destroyed 23 buildings and shelters used by the jihadists, Turkey's armed forces said in a statement on Monday.

headline.main: Turkish Army Says 48 Islamic State Militants Killed in Syria on Sunday
headline.print_headline: Turkish Army Says 48 Islamic State Militants Killed in Syria on Sunday

docs.snippet: French drugmaker Ipsen SA said on Monday it would buy some assets of Merrimack Pharmaceuticals Inc, including pancreatic cancer drug Onivyde, for up to $1 billion, barely a month after the U.S. company stopped a breast cancer drug trial....
docs.lead_paragraph: French drugmaker Ipsen SA said on Monday it would buy some assets of Merrimack Pharmaceuticals Inc, including pancreatic cancer drug Onivyde, for up to $1 billion, barely a month after the U.S. company stopped a breast cancer drug trial.

headline.main: France's Ipsen to Buy Merrimack's Pancreatic Cancer Drug, Assets in $1 Billion Deal
headline.print_headline: France's Ipsen to Buy Merrimack's Pancreatic Cancer Drug, Assets in $1 Billion Deal

docs.snippet: "La La Land" danced off with seven Golden Globes on Sunday on a night marked by upsets and a stinging indictment of U.S. President-elect Donald Trump by Hollywood favorite Meryl Streep....

docs.snippet: Oil markets edged higher on Tuesday on expectations that at least some planned production cuts would be implemented, making a slight recovery from big losses the previous day over doubts the agreed reductions would rebalance an oversupplied market...
docs.lead_paragraph: Oil markets edged higher on Tuesday on expectations that at least some planned production cuts would be implemented, making a slight recovery from big losses the previous day over doubts the agreed reductions would rebalance an oversupplied market.

headline.main: Oil Recovers Some Previous Losses, but Doubts Over Supply Cuts Linger
headline.print_headline: Oil Recovers Some Previous Losses, but Doubts Over Supply Cuts Linger

docs.snippet: Shares of ZTE Corp fell on Monday after company sources said it was cutting 5 percent of its headcount, underscoring troubles at its smartphones business as well as the potential for U.S. trade sanctions to disrupt its supply chain....
docs.lead_paragraph: Shares of ZTE Corp fell on Monday after company sources said it was cutting 5 percent of its headcount, underscoring troubles at its smartphones business as well as the potential for U.S. trade sanctions to disrupt its supply chain.

headline.main: ZTE Shares Fall After Sources Say Five Percent of Headcount to Be Axed
headline.print_headline: ZTE Shares Fall After Sources Say Five Percent of Headcount to Be Axed

docs.snippet: An overloaded coal truck rumbles down from the steel factory and hits a bump, sending chunks of its black cargo skittering and click-clicking along the asphalt. Waiting by the roadside, a farmer swaddled in thick, cotton-padded winter clothing scr...
docs.lead_paragraph: An overloaded coal truck rumbles down from the steel factory and hits a bump, sending chunks of its black cargo skittering and click-clicking along the asphalt. Waiting by the roadside, a farmer swaddled in thick, cotton-padded winter clothing scrambles into onrushing traffic to pick up the pieces.

headline.main: China's Poorest, Trying to Stay Warm, Add Greatly to Smog
headline.print_headline: China's Poorest, Trying to Stay Warm, Add Greatly to Smog
